name: Handbags4Hunger
tag_list: charity, giving, leather-handbags, designer-handbags, womens-handbags, cause-based, cause-based-shopping, handbag, purses, satchels, womens-gifts, holiday-gifts, authentic, designer, brand-name-
overview:
Handbags4Hunger is a shopping site featuring authentic brand new designer handbags, with a portion of each handbag sale going to a hunger charity of the customer’s choice.

All items offered are authentic and brand new, and Handbags4Hunger makes it clear they strongly oppose the sale of counterfeits, replicas, or “designer inspired” products.

The company is located in the Midwestern U.S. (Oshkosh, Wisconsin) and combines a passion for handbags with a love for kids. A portion of the proceeds from each handbag sold goes directly the hunger charity of the customer’s choice, including The Children’s Hunger Fund (CHF), which serves needy children in more than 70 countries worldwide. CHF recently received national acclaim from Forbes.com for being one of America’s most cost-effective charities. More than 99 cents of every dollar donated goes directly to care for the needs of children.

Is Handbags4Hunger a new charity? Handbags4Hunger is not a charity; it’s a business model designed to create awareness and a flow of money from their sales to help eliminate world hunger. Consumers buy their handbags, and at no cost to them, money is sent directly to hunger organizations.

Since its launch in 2008, Handbags4Hunger shoppers have raised enough to buy 100 pounds of staple food items, enough to feed a hungry family of five for eight months. Their business model combines the marketing power of the world’s leading handbag brands with a commitment to combat world hunger.
